definition.name: NXoptical_lens
definition.doc:
An optical lens, typically for a camera detector.
Designed to help spatially map camera pixels to szintillator screens.

field.name: focus_type
field.doc: The type of focus of the lens

field.name: name
field.doc: Given name, alias, colloquial, or short name for the lens. For manufacturer names and identifiers use respective fields.

field.name: manufacturer_name
field.doc: Name of the manufacturer who built/constructed the lens.

field.name: model
field.doc: Model name was given by the manufacturer to identify the lens.

field.name: mount_type
field.doc: Description how the lens is mounted to the camera/detector.

field.name: serial_number
field.doc: Hardware name, hash identifier, or serial number that was given by the manufacturer to identify the lens.

field.name: aperture
field.doc: Diameter of the lens. Q: Does that make more sense in "stops"?

group.doc: This group describes the shape of the beam line component

field.name: depends_on
field.doc:
NeXus positions components by applying a set of translations and rotations to apply to the component starting from 0, 0, 0. The order of these operations is critical and forms what NeXus calls a dependency chain. The depends_on field defines the path to the top most operation of the dependency chain or the string "." if located in the origin. Usually these operations are stored in a NXtransformations group. But NeXus allows them to be stored anywhere.
If missing, the assumption is that the lens is mounted to the enclosing NXdetector (camera) using a camera mount.
This definition assumes a radial symmetry of the lens. The reference location for the lens has the mounting plane to the camera in the x/y plane, with the origin at the centre and z pointing away from the lens body.

group.doc: This is the group recommended for holding the chain of translation and rotation operations necessary to position the component within the instrument. The dependency chain may however traverse similar groups in other component groups.
